content.description:
Climb past two bolts, through the bushes to an optional mid station. Then up the first slab staying right of the tree. The real challenge starts getting on to the second steep slab. Smear, crimp, lay back and drag your body through the crux to the shared anchor. Enjoy the view from the comfy ledge. Bring the second up after you to avoid rope drag. Use long draws. Rap route to descend or climb to the top anchor of Heat Wave.



Hike up and right past Dead Coyote about half way up the cliff band. Starts in a dirty broken corner.

10 bolts and bolted rap anchors.

Climb a series of slabs to crack system and an optional mid station anchor. When pulling past the roof on the first slab just keep reaching up there's a beauty hold up there somewhere! Rap from the mid station for a 5.9 experience or muscle your way up the Cold Finger Crack to the final anchor. Rap route to descend or climb on to the top of Heat Wave



Hike up and right keeping an eye out for blue flagging tape. Starts right of the large roof.

11 bolts and bolted rap anchors.

Climb through some bushes then traverse over the roof and move up into the vertical crack(first crux). After the crack traverse right through flakes and ledges. It is possible to belay from a tree directly above here or for the full effect keep moving right across a small face to another hand eating crack. Jam your way up and over a mantel to the anchor(second crux).



When approaching Ravens Crag go right and up hill when the trail splits at the cliff. Dead Coyote is the first climb you will see. A fairly obvious crack system works its way up and right. Belay from a small stance next to the trail.


Standard rack from #3 to 0.2 and nuts. Bolted rap anchor or tree belay.

climbs.name: Heat Wave
climbs.fa: M. Curran, H. Mutch, L. Bickerton 2015

content.description:
Two pitches or one 70m rope stretcher. Easy 5.7 climbing with one 5.8 move. Rap off the side 30m to descend. Good holds, high friction rock, spacious ledges and a beautiful view of Nelson at sun down down make this an easy classic.



Walk around left to the bottom of the cliff.


10 Bolts and bolted rap anchors.

A steep shady cliff secluded away in the trees with awesome views of Nelson from the top. The rock is rough granite with excellent friction that makes for several quality routes. The base of the crag is steep and managing your gear can require a balancing act. All routes can be descended with a 30m rappel.
